resources.string: What is Privacy Friendly Food Tracker?
Privacy Friendly Food Tracker is an app that allows you to track your calorie intake while maintaining your privacy.

To track your calorie intake, touch a date on the calendar. It will take you to an overview for the chosen date, displaying everything you ate on that particular date. To add an item, touch the button in the bottom right corner.
To edit an item, touch an entry.
To delete one or more entries, press on the item you want to delete for a long time and confirm the deletion.

Privacy Friendly Food Tracker does not require any permissions. It furthermore does not include any tracking mechanisms or advertisements. All information you store with this app are encrypted and only visible to you. The search does however make requests to an online (www.openfoodfacts.org) database. This could potentially still expose some data about your eating habits to the database. If you do not want this, you can simply not use the online search(no data is sent until you press the \"search\" button).

This App helps you track your daily calorie intake without sharing your eating habits with 3rd parties. To guarantee this, we do not request any permissions from you. The search does however make requests to an online (www.openfoodfacts.org) database. This could potentially still expose some data about your eating habits to the database. If you do not want this, you can simply not use the online search(no data is sent until you press the \"search\" button).
To add an entry, touch a day in the calendar. This takes you to an overview of the consumed calories for the chosen date. To add an entry, touch the "+" symbol on the overview screen.
The sourcecode of this app is available at GitHub. For further explanations have a look at the "Help" page.
